results.title: The Work of director Spike Jonze
results.creator_credit: Palm Pictures, Vincent Landay, Richard Brown and Spike Jonze
results.brief_description: This DVD features the work of director Spike Jonze (“Being John Malkovich”,”Adaptation”) from video clips to short films. Before his current success directing feature films, Jonze specialised in directing humorous, inventive and slightly bizarre video clips, spanning a decade. Bands featured include: Wax, Beastie Boys, The Pharcyde, The Breeders, Daft punk, Fatlip, Weezer, Fatboy slim, Dinosaur Jr, and The Chemical Brothers. Some of the clips are quite inventive, playing to Jonzes sense of absurdity and irony. Jonzes short films are just delightful, especially Amarillo by morning; as are the rarities which include footage detailing the Oasis video that never happened and Rockafella Skunks audition tape for Fatboy Slim.

results.title: The Work of art
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Morten Parker
results.brief_description: The National Gallery of Canada serves the Canadian public in many ways. This film tours the galleries in Ottawa where the national collection of old masters, as well as modern works, are on display. It shows how the Gallery helps foster art appreciation. Behind the scenes we see another phase of the work of art—the cleaning, preservation and storing of art treasures.

results.title: The Work of angels : the Book of Kells
results.creator_credit: Crescendo Concept, Muse Film and Television, Viz Ltd, Louis Lentin and Murray Grigor
results.brief_description: Created over 13 centuries ago, The Book of Kells, one of the great glories of Irish Art, ranks among the chief treasures of the Western World. This video tracks the turbulent history of the Irish masterpiece since its conception to its final resting place in the great library of Trinity College in Dublin. Through the imaginative use of high definition film, the secrets and intricacies of this great gospel of Colum Cille, declared by 12th century traveller Giraldus Cambrensis as the work not of men but of angels, are revealed in glorious colour detail.

results.title: The Wordsworth country
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Frank Wells and Derek Mayne
results.brief_description: An introduction to the English Lake District as a background to the study of its literary personalities and especially of Wordsworth and his work. Scenes of Hawkeshead; the Grammar school and the poet’s desk; the village and a May Day Procession; the surrounding hills and lakes. Also of Coniston, Lake Windemere, Grassmere, Dove Cottage, Rydal, and many other places which formed a general background to much of Wordsworth’s work.

results.title: The Woodwind choir
results.brief_description: The individual tonal range and qualities of the various woodwind instruments used in a symphony orchestra, and the techniques of playing them, are demonstrated in this film. Compositions by Brahms, Mendelssohn, Rossini, von Weber, Beethoven, and Schumann are used to demonstrate the function of woodwind instruments in full orchestral setting.

results.title: The Woodlanders
results.creator_credit: Channel Four, Pathe Productions, Barney Reisz and Phil Agland
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Thomas Hardy, “The Woodlanders” is a passionate story of love. Giles Winterborne (Rufus Sewell) and Grace Melbury (Emily Woof) have had an agreement to marry since childhood. However, Grace’s return from boarding school and subsequent elevation in society cause their engagement to be called off. Silently adored by his friend, Marty, Giles continues to pine for Grace, whilst she in turn falls in love with the handsome new doctor, Fitzpiers. But as they follow their separate courses, Grace and Giles find that their lives become inextricably entwined.

results.title: The Wooden horse
results.creator_credit: London Film Productions, Wessex Films, Ian Dalrymple and Jack Lee
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “The Wooden Horse” by Eric Williams. This is a classic wartime escape film which will not fail to enthrall. Many attempts were made to escape Nazi prison camps and a band of British officers planned a daring, ingenious escape from the notorious Stalag Luft III. Tunnelling under an exercise horse, they fought a dangerous battle to survive. Starring Leo Genn, David Tomlinson and Anthony Steel.

results.title: The Wonderful world of Jack Paar = Jack Paar credit titles
results.brief_description: Norman McLaren was commissioned to design and shoot the main and end credit-titles for the television program The Wonderful World of Jack Paar, a special anniversary item in the long-running interview show hosted by Paar. The sound was also “animated” by McLaren. Credit: “Titles created by N. McLaren, E. Lambart”.

results.title: The Wonderful world of dogs
results.creator_credit: Radio Pictures, Australian Film Commission, ABC-TV (Australia), Channel 4 and Mark Lewis
results.brief_description: 540,000 dogs inhabit the city of Sydney and every one with a story to tell. This whimsical, humorous film tells some of them, and in particular, the story of Fugly, the most impounded dog in Australia, and his impact on the suburb of Mosman. Dog lovers and dog haters alike express their point of view as we watch Fugly roaming the streets. “Some dogs just want to be dogs. Some people want dogs to be people. But dogs will be dogs … and people will be people. We all live together.”

results.title: The Wonderful horrible life of Leni Riefenstahl
results.creator_credit: Omega Film GmbH, Nomad Films, Channel 4, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen and Ray Muller
results.brief_description: The most influential filmmaker of the Third Reich and last great surviving image maker of the Nazis, Leni Riefenstahl is a legend with many faces, both admired and loathed. Rather than being content with updating old prejudices, this documentary approaches the most famous female film director in the world without preconceptions and attempts to decontruct her myth and look at it afresh. Was she a feminist pioneer or a woman of evil? Interviews with Leni Riefenstahl are subtitled in English.
